name: malus-domestica-goldrush
edibility: Fruits are highly edible used as a winter dessert apple fresh, in pies or crisps, or juiced into cider.  It has good storage ability.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: Ovate to round 3" in diameter green-yellow skin with some bronze to red blush at maturity and prominate lenticles.   Then turns deep yellow after storage.  Skin is non-waxy, flesh is medium to coarse grained, acidic, and bright but mellows after storage, resists growing with a complex spicy flavor.  Seeds are black-brown.
flower-description: Rose to magenta fading to white margins appear in April
leaf-description: Simple, alternate, ovate to oval, serrate to double serrate margins, tips acute to acuminate, base acute to rounded.  Petioles have red pigmentation which is more prevalent with sun exposure.
